summary: The document details the operational plan for AMTRUNK VII, a clandestine operation designed to recruit dissidents within the Cuban military to conspire against Fidel Castro. It outlines the objectives, tasks, personnel, and equipment necessary for the operation, including the recruitment of a high-profile pilot close to Raul Castro and the transportation of a clandestine radio set into Havana. The mission's scope was adjusted to prioritize the exfiltration of a key agent in grave danger. The operation involved a five-man team with specialized roles, extensive training, and a comprehensive list of equipment.
key_findings: Operation AMTRUNK VII aimed to recruit dissidents within the Cuban military to conspire against Fidel Castro.
The mission scope was altered to prioritize the exfiltration of AMTRUNK-9 due to grave danger.
Key tasks included recruiting Jose Alberto SEMIDEY Isalgue, a pilot close to Raul Castro, and transporting a clandestine radio set into Havana.
The operation involved a five-man team with specific roles, including a radio operator and guides familiar with the infiltration area.
Extensive training and equipment were provided to the team, including weapons, communication gear, and survival supplies.
